Fidelity investments says the 4 year BTC cycle is replaced by a 10 year long cycle. Read below, these guys are never wrong, I asked GEMINI to analyse the report:

Fidelity (specifically Fidelity Digital Assets and Fidelity Labs) discussed the possibility of a Bitcoin "supercycle" in late December 2025 and early January 2026.

The specific quote regarding a "decade-long" shift stems from their 2026 Crypto Market Outlook, which was released around January 9, 2026.

Key Details

The Comparison: Fidelity analysts, including Parth Gargava (Managing Partner at Fidelity Labs) and Chris Kuiper (Director of Research at Fidelity Digital Assets), compared the current Bitcoin market to the commodities supercycle of the 2000s, which lasted nearly a decade.

The Argument: They suggested that Bitcoin might be moving away from its traditional four-year halving cycle. Instead of sharp boom-and-bust patterns, they posited that structural demand (ETFs, corporate buying, and government reserves) could lead to "prolonged highs and shallower dips."

Context of "Decade-Long": While they didn't guarantee a 10-year rally, they used the decade-long commodity cycle as a historical template for what a "supercycle" looks like.
---
My take is "the 10 yr cycle is 2.5x (the halving cycles) and a multiplier of BTC at current market prices, as a bare minimum". The same could be massive multiples for mid and micro-caps. 
-Coinstar.

üî• Ever wonder what happens when crypto like $XRP  gets "burned"?  Tokens get sent to a dead wallet, an address with no private key.   Once there, they're gone forever. Permanently removed from circulation  The process follows clear steps: a burn decision is made, tokens are collected from fees or reserves, transferred to the burn address, and removed from supply permanently  Every burn is recorded on the blockchain. Full transparency. Anyone can verify it  For XRP, transaction fees work this way, small amounts burned with each transaction, slowly reducing total supply over time  Understanding tokenomics like burn mechanics helps you see beyond just price action üìö  #XRP  #XRPL  #XRPBurn  #XRPLedger
